instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V35_CAM: What is PP1V35_CAM? PP1V35_CAM is a 1.35v power rail to power the webcam. .
definitions.PP1V8_CAM: What is PP1V8_CAM? PP1V8_CAM is a 1.8v power rail for powering the webcam.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Camera
threads.message:
LB is in S0 state. PP3V3S0 present. <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> not producing <SIGNAL>PP1V2_CAM</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP1V8_CAM</SIGNAL>, or <SIGNAL>PP1V35_CAM</SIGNAL>.
No other issues, just onboard camera does not power on.
<SIGNAL>CAM_DEBUG_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 0. Slightly confused, it is <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> that produces <SIGNAL>PP1V8_CAM</SIGNAL>, correct?

Thanks,

Stefan

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Camera
threads.message:
Close please!
<SIGNAL>CAMERA_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> was missing.
<RESISTOR>R2030</RESISTOR> zero ohm link was burned and needed replaced.
